meanings.definition: The act of valuing something too highly.
meanings.sent1: Some people fall into the trap of overvaluations when pricing their belongings.
meanings.sent2: The market crash was caused by widespread overvaluations of properties.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit hilariously portrayed the absurdity of overvaluations in the art world.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like overvaluations, blinding her to his flaws.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overvaluations can be financially devastating.

meanings.definition: The state of being valued too highly.
meanings.sent1: Investors realized the overvaluations of the company's stocks and started selling.
meanings.sent2: The overvaluations of her skills led to unrealistic expectations from her boss.
meanings.sent3: The fashion industry often thrives on the overvaluations of designer brands.
meanings.sent4: In the fairy tale, the princess's beauty was an overvaluations that caused envy among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The bubble burst when the market corrected the overvaluations of the tech sector.
